00024 bool FileStat::Stat(DiskInterface* disk_interface) {
00025   mtime_ = disk_interface->Stat(path_);
00026   return mtime_ > 0;
00027 }
00028 
00029 bool Edge::RecomputeDirty(State* state, DiskInterface* disk_interface,
00030                           string* err) {
00031   bool dirty = false;
00032 
00033   if (!rule_->depfile_.empty()) {
00034     if (!LoadDepFile(state, disk_interface, err))
00035       return false;
00036   }
00037 
00038   time_t most_recent_input = 1;
00039   for (vector<Node*>::iterator i = inputs_.begin(); i != inputs_.end(); ++i) {
00040     if ((*i)->file_->StatIfNecessary(disk_interface)) {
00041       if (Edge* edge = (*i)->in_edge_) {
00042         if (!edge->RecomputeDirty(state, disk_interface, err))
00043           return false;
00044       } else {
00045         // This input has no in-edge; it is dirty if it is missing.
00046         // But it's ok for implicit deps to be missing.
00047         if (!is_implicit(i - inputs_.begin()))
00048           (*i)->dirty_ = !(*i)->file_->exists();
00049       }
00050     }
00051 
00052     if (is_order_only(i - inputs_.begin())) {
00053       // Order-only deps only make us dirty if they're missing.
00054       if (!(*i)->file_->exists())
00055         dirty = true;
00056       continue;
00057     }
00058 
00059     // If a regular input is dirty (or missing), we're dirty.
00060     // Otherwise consider mtime.
00061     if ((*i)->dirty_) {
00062       dirty = true;
00063     } else {
00064       if ((*i)->file_->mtime_ > most_recent_input)
00065         most_recent_input = (*i)->file_->mtime_;
00066     }
00067   }
00068 
00069   string command = EvaluateCommand();
00070 
00071   assert(!outputs_.empty());
00072   for (vector<Node*>::iterator i = outputs_.begin(); i != outputs_.end(); ++i) {
00073     // We may have other outputs, that our input-recursive traversal hasn't hit
00074     // yet (or never will).  Stat them if we haven't already.
00075     (*i)->file_->StatIfNecessary(disk_interface);
00076 
00077     // Output is dirty if we're dirty, we're missing the output,
00078     // or if it's older than the most recent input mtime.
00079     if (dirty || !(*i)->file_->exists() ||
00080         (*i)->file_->mtime_ < most_recent_input) {
00081       (*i)->dirty_ = true;
00082     } else {
00083       // May also be dirty due to the command changing since the last build.
00084       BuildLog::LogEntry* entry;
00085       if (state->build_log_ &&
00086           (entry = state->build_log_->LookupByOutput((*i)->file_->path_))) {
00087         if (command != entry->command)
00088           (*i)->dirty_ = true;
00089       }
00090     }
00091   }
00092   return true;
00093 }
00094 
00095 /// An Env for an Edge, providing $in and $out.
00096 struct EdgeEnv : public Env {
00097   EdgeEnv(Edge* edge) : edge_(edge) {}
00098   virtual string LookupVariable(const string& var) {
00099     string result;
00100     if (var == "in") {
00101       int explicit_deps = edge_->inputs_.size() - edge_->implicit_deps_ -
00102           edge_->order_only_deps_;
00103       for (vector<Node*>::iterator i = edge_->inputs_.begin();
00104            i != edge_->inputs_.end() && explicit_deps; ++i, --explicit_deps) {
00105         if (!result.empty())
00106           result.push_back(' ');
00107         result.append((*i)->file_->path_);
00108       }
00109     } else if (var == "out") {
00110       result = edge_->outputs_[0]->file_->path_;
00111     } else if (edge_->env_) {
00112       return edge_->env_->LookupVariable(var);
00113     }
00114     return result;
00115   }
00116   Edge* edge_;
00117 };
00118 
00119 string Edge::EvaluateCommand() {
00120   EdgeEnv env(this);
00121   return rule_->command_.Evaluate(&env);
00122 }
00123 
00124 string Edge::GetDescription() {
00125   EdgeEnv env(this);
00126   return rule_->description_.Evaluate(&env);
00127 }

00129 bool Edge::LoadDepFile(State* state, DiskInterface* disk_interface,
00130                        string* err) {
00131   EdgeEnv env(this);
00132   string path = rule_->depfile_.Evaluate(&env);
00133 
00134   string content = disk_interface->ReadFile(path, err);
00135   if (!err->empty())
00136     return false;
00137   if (content.empty())
00138     return true;
00139 
00140   MakefileParser makefile;
00141   string makefile_err;
00142   if (!makefile.Parse(content, &makefile_err)) {
00143     *err = path + ": " + makefile_err;
00144     return false;
00145   }
00146 
00147   // Check that this depfile matches our output.
00148   if (outputs_.size() != 1) {
00149     *err = "expected only one output";
00150     return false;
00151   }
00152   if (outputs_[0]->file_->path_ != makefile.out_) {
00153     *err = "expected makefile to mention '" + outputs_[0]->file_->path_ + "', "
00154            "got '" + makefile.out_ + "'";
00155     return false;
00156   }
00157 
00158   // Add all its in-edges.
00159   for (vector<string>::iterator i = makefile.ins_.begin();
00160        i != makefile.ins_.end(); ++i) {
00161     if (!CanonicalizePath(&*i, err))
00162       return false;
00163 
00164     Node* node = state->GetNode(*i);
00165     inputs_.insert(inputs_.end() - order_only_deps_, node);
00166     node->out_edges_.push_back(this);
00167     ++implicit_deps_;
00168   }
00169 
00170   return true;
00171 }
00172 
00173 void Edge::Dump() {
00174   printf("[ ");
00175   for (vector<Node*>::iterator i = inputs_.begin(); i != inputs_.end(); ++i) {
00176     printf("%s ", (*i)->file_->path_.c_str());
00177   }
00178   printf("--%s-> ", rule_->name_.c_str());
00179   for (vector<Node*>::iterator i = outputs_.begin(); i != outputs_.end(); ++i) {
00180     printf("%s ", (*i)->file_->path_.c_str());
00181   }
00182   printf("]\n");
00183 }
00184 
00185 bool Edge::is_phony() const {
00186   return rule_ == &State::kPhonyRule;
00187 }
